txt.en: Tephísa
A girl watches you from outside the cage
Jajax sleeps on, oblivious to everything.
Jajax rests on a cot by the entrance of the cage.
It is difficult to measure the passing of time in the cage.

Perhaps if you <rgb=#00FF00>beckon</rgb> the girl she will speak to you.
The girl eyes you warily.
The girl eyes you warily.
'TBD - Blah!'
'I trust you two are comfortable?'
The girl eyes you warily.
'Such hostility!'
'They will do as they are told.'
Ashenâth
Talk to Jajax
'TBD - Blah!'
'I feared the din of celebration in the city above might keep you from sleeping.'
'When next I return you may believe differently. Farewell.'
Listen to the words of your captor
Tephísa waits for your response.
'The people rejoiced as the Song of Waves and Wind passed the city and sailed onward to Gondor.'
Talk to your captor through the bars of your cage
You have given your answer, and must now wait to see her response.
'For what reason would I lie to you now? Victory is already mine.'
Pass the time in your cage
'Gondor will burn. Umbar will triumph.'
'What have I forgotten?'
<rgb=#00FF00>Beckon</rgb> the girl to speak
'I know it well. I have made it so!'
'The Kindred of the Coins overthrew the Heirs of Castamir and the Church of Barkhûsh!'
Wait for the girl to speak
Talk to the mysterious girl
There is nothing more you can do but wait.
'How can... how can you know that name?'
Desperate for tidings from above, captives wrestle with their helplessness in the face of the evil that threatens Umbar and Gondor.
Even through the bars you can see the pain in her eyes
'I did not always live in the shadows of Umbar-môkh.'
'I had a home in the city, once, and family who loved me.'
Listen to what the girl has to say
'But... they did not survive the flames of Barkhûsh.'
'I have been Tephísa ever since that day.'
'Nothing comes for free.'
'If I help you to escape, I need something from you: a promise.'
'Will you swear to destroy the ships and their masters?'
See what Jajax thinks
'Then I will find someone else.'
'Did you hear that? Someone is coming.'
'So it is pledged, and I will not forget.'
'Why have you come here, Hármelak?'
'You have forgotten something, Hármelak. You may learn it again to your sorrow.'
'Umbar is a free city.'
'The people did this.'
'How will they react when Nakási returns with her fleet?'
'How will they welcome its crews of Heirsworn, Orcs, and Ordâkhai?'
'Maybe. But I would not.'
'You might as well get some sleep. We may be here awhile.'
Talk to Jajax
Pass the time in your cage
Listen to the words of your visitor
Listen to what the girl has to say
Instance: The Cage and the Captives
